description.narrative: By 2016, selected Communication for Development (C4D) government and CSO partners have enhanced their Communication for Development (C4D) capacity and are effectively supporting line Ministries to manage focused and coordinated multi-level, multi-channel interventions with a focus on four priority provinces (2.5 Capacity Development), which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, young people, women and their duty bearers in targeted provinces and emergency prone areas adopt, sustain, and promote select behaviours, attitudes and practices, to improve their well-being, to promote adherence to essential services and especially help reduce early pregnancy, child marriage, malnutrition, lack of sanitation and HIV infection.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, selected C4D government and CSO partners have enhanced their C4D capacity and are effectively supporting line Ministriesto manage focused and coordinated multi-level, multi-channel interventions with a focus on four priority provinces (2.5 CapacityDevelopment)

description.narrative: Progress achieved in the development of several C4D strategies, such as the SBCC strategy for nutrition, the PMTCT and Child Treatment Communication Strategy and the start of several consultancies to support the government. However, the new Health Promotion strategy was not launched by the Ministry of Health jeopardizing its implementation. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:20/01/2017

title.narrative: of health committees revitalized in Tete ad Zambezia with UNICEF support

actual.value: 2016:16 Heath committees revitalized in Two districts of Tete province. Community involvement meeting conducted in 3 districts of Zambezia Province.

title.narrative: Availability of C4D strategies that meet UNICEF global benchmarks

baseline.value: 4 strategies (2010 2014 health promotion, Malaria prevention, breastfeeding promotion, cholera prevention)

target.value: 2016:: 7 new strategies (health promotion strategy, CNCS/HIV, nutrition, vaccination, early marriage, quality education, child participation) – 2015 – 2016

actual.value: 2016:Three new strategies developed (Health Promotion Strategy 2015-2019, SBCC strategy for nutrition and child participation strategy) finalized and endorsed, Communication strategy to adhere to PMTCT and Child Treatment developed and being reviewed by partners, consultancy to develop the C4D plan for v

title.narrative: MOH Health Promotion strategy disseminated in all provinces

actual.value: 2016:MoH Health promotion strategy approved by MoH and the document shared with DPS, however the strategy was not yet launched.

title.narrative: GABINFO C4D Policy Developed and disseminated

actual.value: 2016:Terms of reference has been changed to be able to first tackle C4D capacity building from 2017.
